docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout ├── README.md ├── backend │ ├── app │ ├── ml │ │ ├── mlflow.db │ │ ├── mlruns │ │ └── train_model.py │ ├── model │ │ ├── model.pkl │ ├── requirements.txt │ └── tests │ │ ├── test_api.py │ │ └──test_train.py ├── docs │ ├── index.md │ └── user_guide │ └── getting_started.md ├── frontend │ ├── app.py │ └── requirements.txt ├── main.py ├── mkdocs.yml ├── pyproject.toml └── uv.lock

docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: Install dependencies Create a new virtual environment named .venv in the current directory. python3 -m venv .venv Activate the virtual environment .venv. source .venv/bin/activate Synchronize all project dependencies using the uv uv sync
docs.title: Install dependencies
Create a new virtual environment named .venv in the current directory.
Synchronize all project dependencies using the uv

docs.text: Instructions for manually running all components of the project on your local machine. 1. MLflow UI What it does: lets you inspect artifacts, metrics, and other logs created during model training.cript: train_model.py mlflow ui --backend-store-uri sqlite:///mlflow.db --default-artifact-root ./mlruns MLflow UI is available at: http://127.0.0.1:5000 2. Train the Model Script: train_model.py What it does: loads the Iris dataset, trains a Logistic Regression model, saves the model to ml/model/model.pkl, and logs metrics and artifacts to MLflow. ~/Pipeline_CI_CD$ python -m backend.ml.train_model 3. Start the API Script: backend/app/main.py (FastAPI) What it does: starts the API with two endpoints: GET / – health check, returns {"message": "API is working"} POST /predict – accepts input data and returns the predicted Iris class. ~/Pipeline_CI_CD$ uvicorn backend.app.main:app --reload API is available at: http://127.0.0.1:8000 4. Launch Streamlit Script: app/dashboard.py What it does: visualizes predictions. ~/Pipeline_CI_CD$ streamlit run frontend/app.py
docs.title: Manual run
Instructions for manually running all components of the project on your local machine.

docs.text: mlflow ui --backend-store-uri sqlite:///mlflow.db --default-artifact-root ./mlruns MLflow UI is available at: http://127.0.0.1:5000
